Concepts.name: Time-Independent Schrödinger Equation
Concepts.short_definition: Fundamental equation of non-relativistic quantum mechanics describing stationary states of a system.

Concepts.name: Born–Oppenheimer Approximation
Concepts.short_definition: Approximation separating nuclear and electronic motion due to large mass differences.

Concepts.name: Potential Energy Surface
Concepts.short_definition: Multidimensional surface giving electronic energy as a function of nuclear coordinates.

Concepts.name: Hartree–Fock Theory
Concepts.short_definition: Mean-field method approximating the many-electron wavefunction as a single Slater determinant.

Concepts.name: Electron Correlation
Concepts.short_definition: Difference between exact electronic energy and the Hartree–Fock energy, capturing electron–electron interactions beyond mean-field.

Concepts.name: Density Functional Theory
Concepts.short_definition: Electronic-structure framework where the ground-state energy is a functional of the electron density.

Concepts.name: Gaussian Basis Sets
Concepts.short_definition: Sets of Gaussian-type orbitals used to represent molecular orbitals in ab initio and DFT calculations.

Concepts.name: Plane-Wave Basis Sets
Concepts.short_definition: Plane-wave expansions used to represent electronic wavefunctions in periodic systems, controlled by kinetic energy cutoff.

Concepts.name: Effective Core Potentials
Concepts.short_definition: Pseudopotentials replacing core electrons with an effective potential to reduce basis size and include scalar relativistic effects.

Concepts.name: Self-Consistent Field Procedure
Concepts.short_definition: Iterative procedure to reach consistency between the Fock/Kohn–Sham operator and the resulting orbitals or density.

Concepts.name: Geometry Optimization
Concepts.short_definition: Algorithmic procedure to locate minima or transition states on the potential energy surface using energy and gradients.

Concepts.name: Vibrational Frequency Analysis
Concepts.short_definition: Computation of harmonic normal modes from the Hessian matrix, used to characterize stationary points and thermochemistry.

Concepts.name: Transition State and Reaction Pathways
Concepts.short_definition: First-order saddle point on a potential energy surface corresponding to the highest energy along the minimum-energy path.

Concepts.name: Charge and Population Analysis
Concepts.short_definition: Schemes to partition electron density into atomic contributions (Mulliken, Löwdin, NBO, Hirshfeld, etc.).

Concepts.name: Dispersion Corrections
Concepts.short_definition: Additive or nonlocal corrections to account for London dispersion interactions missing in many DFT functionals.

Concepts.name: Relativistic Quantum Chemistry
Concepts.short_definition: Treatment of electronic structure including relativistic effects using scalar-relativistic Hamiltonians or four-component Dirac equations.

Concepts.name: Coupled Cluster Theory
Concepts.short_definition: Wavefunction method using an exponential ansatz with cluster operators to include electron correlation in a size-extensive manner.

Concepts.name: Multireference Methods
Concepts.short_definition: Methods that use more than one determinant as reference to describe systems with strong static correlation.

Concepts.name: Molecular Dynamics and Ab Initio MD
Concepts.short_definition: Simulation of nuclear motion using classical equations of motion, with forces from empirical potentials or on-the-fly quantum chemistry.

Concepts.name: QM/MM Hybrid Methods
Concepts.short_definition: Hybrid approach where a quantum region is embedded in a larger classical environment.

Concepts.name: Linux and High-Performance Computing Basics
Concepts.short_definition: Command-line usage, job schedulers, and basic resource management required to run large quantum chemistry workloads.

Concepts.name: Python Automation for Quantum Chemistry
Concepts.short_definition: Use of Python and libraries such as ASE, PySCF, and cclib to generate inputs, submit jobs, and analyze results.

Methods.name: Hartree–Fock
strengths: Simple, size-consistent, useful reference for post-HF
weaknesses: Neglects dynamic correlation, poor for dispersion

Methods.name: Restricted Hartree–Fock
weaknesses: Not suitable for open-shell or bond-breaking cases

Methods.name: MP2
strengths: Includes dynamic correlation, good for noncovalent interactions at modest cost
weaknesses: Basis-set sensitive, can overbind, fails for strong correlation

Methods.name: CCSD
suitable_for: Small to medium molecules with single-reference character

Methods.name: CCSD(T)
strengths: Gold standard for many ground-state properties
weaknesses: Very expensive, fails for strong multireference cases

Methods.name: CASSCF
strengths: Captures static correlation, good for excited states and bond breaking
weaknesses: Requires careful active space selection, lacks dynamic correlation
unsuitable_for: Large systems without clear active space

Methods.name: PBE
weaknesses: Underestimates some barriers and band gaps

Methods.name: B3LYP
strengths: Popular hybrid functional with decent performance for many organic systems
weaknesses: Mediocre for kinetics, dispersion, and modern benchmarks

Methods.name: M06-2X
strengths: Good for main-group thermochemistry and kinetics

Methods.name: ωB97X-D
strengths: Range-separated hybrid with dispersion, good general-purpose accuracy
suitable_for: Broad set of molecules, noncovalent interactions
unsuitable_for: Very large systems with minimal resources

Methods.name: TD-DFT
weaknesses: Struggles with charge-transfer and Rydberg states for some functionals

Methods.name: GFN2-xTB
strengths: Very fast, good for geometries and conformer searches
weaknesses: Energies less reliable than DFT/ab initio in difficult cases

Methods.name: DFTB3
strengths: Fast, suitable for MD of large systems

SoftwareTools.name: Gaussian
SoftwareTools.input_style: Route section and Z-matrix/Cartesian coordinates in text input files
SoftwareTools.output_style: Text log files with energies, gradients, properties
SoftwareTools.performance_notes: Mature code, parallel performance can be moderate compared to newer codes
limitations: Closed-source, license cost, less flexible scripting

SoftwareTools.name: ORCA
SoftwareTools.output_style: Text log files and auxiliary files (Molden, gbw)
SoftwareTools.performance_notes: Excellent parallel scalability on multicore systems
limitations: Some high-level methods less extensive than specialized codes

SoftwareTools.name: Psi4
SoftwareTools.output_style: Text logs with optional NumPy data
limitations: Less specialized spectroscopy than some commercial codes

SoftwareTools.name: Turbomole
SoftwareTools.performance_notes: Excellent DFT performance for larger systems

SoftwareTools.name: MOLPRO
SoftwareTools.performance_notes: Designed for very accurate small/medium system calculations
limitations: Not optimized for very large systems

SoftwareTools.name: GAMESS
limitations: Less modern infrastructure than some newer codes

SoftwareTools.name: ADF
SoftwareTools.output_style: Text logs, graphical output via GUI
limitations: DFT-focused, not a general wavefunction code

SoftwareTools.name: xTB
SoftwareTools.performance_notes: Excellent for large systems and conformer scans
limitations: Limited accuracy for difficult electronic structures

SoftwareTools.name: DFTB+
SoftwareTools.performance_notes: Scales to large systems with MD

SoftwareTools.name: MOPAC
SoftwareTools.license: Free for some uses, commercial for others

SoftwareTools.name: cclib
core_features: Parse outputs from many QC codes

Parameters.name: def2-SVP
Parameters.description: Split-valence double-zeta basis from the def2 family.
Parameters.effect_on_accuracy: Moderate accuracy, good compromise for geometry optimizations

Parameters.name: def2-TZVP
Parameters.description: Triple-zeta valence plus polarization basis from the def2 family.

Parameters.name: cc-pVDZ
Parameters.effect_on_accuracy: Lower than triple-zeta, good for trends

Parameters.name: cc-pVTZ
Parameters.effect_on_accuracy: High accuracy when combined with post-HF

Parameters.name: aug-cc-pVDZ
Parameters.effect_on_accuracy: Improves description of diffuse electron density

Parameters.name: 6-31G*
Parameters.description: Pople split-valence basis with polarization on heavy atoms.
Parameters.effect_on_accuracy: Reasonable but dated; superseded by modern basis sets

Parameters.name: SCF Tight Convergence
Parameters.description: Stricter SCF convergence thresholds for energy and density.

Parameters.name: Fine Integration Grid
Parameters.description: Denser numerical grid for DFT integration.
Parameters.effect_on_cost: Increased CPU time per SCF cycle

Parameters.name: Plane-Wave Cutoff (CP2K)
Parameters.description: Energy cutoff controlling the resolution of plane-wave expansion.
Parameters.effect_on_accuracy: Higher cutoff increases accuracy but cost

Parameters.name: k-Point Mesh
Parameters.description: Grid used to sample the Brillouin zone in periodic calculations.
Parameters.effect_on_accuracy: More k-points improve convergence for metals and small-bandgap systems
Parameters.effect_on_cost: Increases number of SCF calculations per step

Workflows.name: Basic DFT Geometry Optimization and Frequency Analysis
Workflows.goal: Obtain an optimized geometry and verify stationary point for a closed-shell molecule.

steps.description: Build initial structure (e.g. using ASE or a molecular editor).
Run DFT geometry optimization with a hybrid functional and medium basis (e.g., B3LYP/def2-SVP).
Run harmonic frequency analysis at the optimized geometry to confirm a minimum (no imaginary frequencies).

Workflows.name: Conformer Search with xTB/CREST and DFT Refinement
Workflows.goal: Identify and refine the lowest-energy conformers of a flexible organic molecule.

steps.description: Generate conformers using CREST and GFN2-xTB.
Cluster and select unique low-energy conformers.
Re-optimize selected conformers using DFT (e.g., B3LYP/def2-SVP).
